# Custom White Balance

Choose ğŸ„Ÿ1, ğŸ„Ÿ2, or ğŸ„Ÿ3 to adjust white balance for unusual lighting conditions using a white object as a reference (colored objects can also be used to lend photos a color cast). A white balance target will be displayed; position and size the target so that it is filled by the reference object and press the shutter button all the way down to measure white balance (to select the most recent custom value and exit without measuring white balance, press **DISP/BACK**, or press **MENU/OK** to select the most recent value and display the fine-tuning dialog).

!Custom White Balance Display

- If â€œUNDERâ€ is displayed, raise exposure compensation and try again.
- If â€œOVERâ€ is displayed, lower exposure compensation and try again.
